result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A. Rellinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle A. Rellinger

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:00 am 
INCLUDES 18CF150, 16CM208, 15CF537, AND 14CF13. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn. 

PLEA HEARING IN 18CF150. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Manufacture-Deliver LSD/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Manufacture-Deliver LSD/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 3 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN 18CF150 AND SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 16CM208, 15CF537, AND 14CF13. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 18CF150: Ct. 1>>7 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 4 years ES. 
                    : Ct. 3>>5 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 2 years ES. 
In 16CM208: Ct. 1>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC & 1 year ES. 
In 15CF537: Ct. 1>>3 years imprisonment - 2 years IC & 1 year ES. 
                    : Ct. 2>>3 years imprisonment - 2 years IC & 1 year ES. 
In 14CF13: Ct. 1>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES>>AODA unless already done; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances and no possession of controlled substances except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; CC including DNA surcharge. 

COURT finds the def entitled to jail credit as follows: 
In 18CF150>>96 days credit. 
In 16CM208>>115 days credit. 
In 15CF537>>264 days credit. 
In 14CF13>>335 days credit. 

COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 
Adj: 11:15 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 14, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 14, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Calendar call on March 22, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:30am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears in person (on huber from jail) and with Atty Paul Goetz.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VR not applicable.

State moves to:
Ct. 3 (Fleeing Officer/Repeater)>>D&RI
Ct. 4 (Poss Para/Repeater)>>D&RI
Ct. 5 (Cary Concealed Weapon/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Poss Narcotic Drugs-Heroin/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 (Poss THC/2nd+ Offense/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.
Argument by counsel on conditional jail time; Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on both counts; 3 years probation on each count, concurrent to each other and to any other probation defendant is currently serving.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety; AODA and any follow up as recommended; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; DNA sample and surcharge; CC; In Ct. 1 ONLY>>> 9 months MCJ - 3 months to be served and other 6 months I&S, w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin immediately, concurrent with sentence that defendant is now serving.

Adj: 10:57am

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Paul Goetz. Waiver of Prelim. filed. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY 
FPT- 07/17/15 at 9:40 a.m. in Br.4 office.

C: Br.4

No contact with victim(s): J.R. (co-deft) unless for work/business.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.
